meanings.definition: A close-fitting, insulating garment made of neoprene or similar material, worn by divers, surfers, etc. to retain body heat in cold water.
meanings.sent1: The diver put on his wetsuit before jumping into the chilly ocean.
meanings.sent2: Surfers often wear a wetsuit to stay warm while riding the waves.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to squeeze into a tiny wetsuit for a swim, but it was too small!
meanings.sent4: Her wetsuit was like a cozy hug, keeping her snug in the icy water.
meanings.sent5: The bright red wetsuit stood out against the blue sea, a beacon of warmth.

meanings.definition: To put on or wear a wetsuit.
meanings.sent1: She will wetsuit up before heading out to surf in the morning.
meanings.sent2: They wetsuit before diving into the deep sea for exploration.
meanings.sent3: He wetsuits like a superhero transforming into his gear before a mission.
meanings.sent4: Wetsuiting up, she felt ready to conquer the cold water challenge.
meanings.sent5: Before the race, the swimmers wetsuit to prepare for the competition.
